item.title: A Note on Souls
item.description: Author: Charles DeZeta Co-author: Dr. Krickee It is proved in science, theology, and magic that the Soul is directly bound to one’s legs.

item.title: Arkhaos Cloud
item.description: The Arkhaos Cloud threatens to turn every living thing into a servant of doom, corrupting their minds and enslaving their wills.

item.title: Arkhism
item.description: Monotheistic Arkists are a cult-like group, even calling themselves a cult on occasions, who embrace the coming of the [[Arkhaos Cloud]] and wish to seek recognition from Arkhaos himself.

item.title: Book of Dooms
item.description: An Archivist’s Prologue: The full magnitude of the Book of Dooms has not been preserved over time. The small fragments and verses contained within this text are considered to be some the most important, or at least, the most well-preserved.

item.title: Book of Light
item.description: Whimsy Avast ye merry people of the land, the world, and the sky. The world arises, opens, and unfolds into our gaping grasp.

item.title: Eclipses
item.description: In [[Lantemar]], the world revolves around its sun, [[Sunnir]], facing it nearly always. There are seasons in this world, but they have such a small effect that keeping their track is unreasonable.

item.title: Energism
item.description: Polytheistic There are very few Energists, and very little is known about them. They worship Vishna, and respect all her decisions as law.

item.title: Four Relics
item.description: There are seven relics required to activate the stormkeep. A pendant made of wood that shines like crystal, shaped like the forboding raven.

item.title: Krickee's Guide ter' Stoppin' the Storm
item.description: Well, thar’ be quite a few ways to stop the storm milads. But I’ll be goin’ over the methods most prominently discussed.

item.title: Lani'okaja Theses
item.description: Thesis of the Air From nothing, came Akalani. The air appeared, and Akalani took form. The embodiment of the new, the embodiment of change.

item.title: Laniism (Religion)
item.description: Animistic/Polytheistic Laniism is one of the two Major Religions in the world of [[Lantemar]]. Laniists follow the [[Lani’okaja Theses]] and, in total, four deities:

item.title: Lantemar
item.description: ![[lantemar.png]] The known world! Lantemar is what the people call the known reaches of the planetoid they have explored, or Eylant in some more ancient texts.

item.title: Mystic Weapons
item.description: Mystic Weapons are soul-bound weapons whose properties can be attached to any weapon of choice. Additionally, any Mystic Weapon can be attached to any spellcasting focus.

item.title: Peto'ns Dictation
item.description: The world here is to confuse you. Each faith has only fragments of the truth. Join our [[Petoism]], join our fold.

item.title: Petoism
item.description: Monotheistic The goal of Petoism is to persue clean activities, good behaviors, and to be of service. The reasoning of these actions is to become closer to Petolani, the true god of Petoism, and the creator of worlds.

item.title: Places
item.description: Lant – Physical Plane This realm holds all physical matter. Extraphysical matter does exist outside of this realm, while physical matter can although it does not.

item.title: Plannir
item.description: A magnificent astral body, Plannir is the physical manifestation of the [[Planes]] beyond Lant. Plannir works as a series of orbiting shells, each one containing a plane layered deeper and deeper.

item.title: Pure Laniism
item.description: Polytheistic The goal of Laniism is to become one with the three greater deities, Akalani, Okolani, and Petolani, by studying the doctrine of [[Lani’okaja Theses]], sent from the heavens by Lani’eni.

item.title: Pure Seerism
item.description: Polytheistic Pure Seerists are the most common sect of Seerism. They follow the teachings of the Book of Light and consider all gods to be important, with the Overseer being the most important among them.

item.title: Religion
item.description: There are two major religions in [[Lantemar]]. This document should be a full briefing on everything you need to know.

item.title: Ren Bell
item.description: An inter-planal magical alarm for [[Ren’owa Arkhana, Master of Blades]]. When rung, Ren will appear. There is no guarantee he will stay if he is busy, or uninterested in your plight.

item.title: Ren'owa Arkhana, Master of Blades
item.description: Master Ren is a fearsome opponent. He is a dark freelancer, who has heavy ties with [[Arkhism]], and Tiefling Cultists.

item.title: Seerism (Religion)
item.description: Polytheistic Seerism is one of the two Major Religions in the world of [[Lantemar|Lantemar]] Seerists follow the [[Book of Light (Abridged)|Book of Light (Abridged)]] and, in total, six deities:

item.title: Stalism
item.description: Monotheistic Stalists primarily worship Stalnir. They believe in vanquishing abominations and heavily study the Book of Light. They practice ordinances and many seek to find Stalnir to seek advice.

item.title: Stalnir's Word
item.description: Come to the point of Convergence Where the storm and the north meet I come to you in private I am Stalnir, Lord of Light

item.title: Sunnir
item.description: Sunnir, or the sun, is the light-giving astral body that [[Lantemar]] orbits. It is said in [[Seerism]] and [[Stalism]] to be a representation of Stalnir’s light.

item.title: The Elven King's Letter
item.description: Dearest Esmerelda, I have for you a relic of legend Come to my kingdom, The Great Oak, and we shall meet and be merry.

item.title: The Flutist's Song - Oh Geraldo!
item.description: This is the tale of a horrible lad, One who became more a “man”, Tried to be strong, tried to be good,

item.title: The Guardsman's Only Key
item.description: Added Damage = 1d10 - 2 + STR > 0 The user can predict an event, as many as # of mysticism points / 2 per long rest.

item.title: The Liar's Only Love
item.description: Added Damage = 1d4 + CHA + 1 The user can anticipate their opponent’s next action, expending two Mysticism points, dodging their attack entirely.

item.title: The Warden's Vault of Souls
item.description: Added Damage = (LVL + DEX) / 2 If the user deals a killing blow to a being with this weapon, they can trap their soul in an astral box.
